messages: f1259a9f9150e84e5c67c9e8f44cc1d2 (03:42): I have not been able to follow the html-wg for some time. I have been reviewing the Maciej 'Proposal for Keyboard Shortcuts' and the Aaron 'ARIA in HTML threads.' Please comment on my take - <command> shortcuts would be used on 'plain' HTML pages, ie. the author does not use Javascript and ARIA would require the use of Javascript. Does ARIA provide any more functionality?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:43): ARIA is not a mechanism for keyboard shortcuts
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:43): the two are orthogonal
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:43): some people think certain roles should be assigned a default keyboard shortcut
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:44): but I don't think there are any existing ARIA roles that would correspond to the semantics of a specific command
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:44): yeah you have to implement key nav with script
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:45): that makes it possible to have it be key navigable with IE as well anyway, which doesn't have ARIA support
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:45): and on Opera which is just starting to have ARIA support
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:46): i guess the 2 are complimentary, for good web 2.0 accesssibility you need both key nav and  aria
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:46): I'm not sure what you mean by "implement key nav with script"

139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:47): my proposal is for keyboard shortcuts for commands (like things you would find in the menu bar for a native app), not for keyboard navigation of controls (like with tab / shift-tab)
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:48): I don't see how ARIA is at all related to this
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:48): right, sorry, i'm talking about complex container controls
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:48): there are no ARIA roles for "Bold" or "Reply" or "New Document"
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:48): ARIA talks about using tabindex to enable complex navigation as found in tree controls and grids etc.
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:48): you might want to be able to arrow through those menus as well

f1259a9f9150e84e5c67c9e8f44cc1d2 (03:48): http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/ARIA:_Accessible_Rich_Internet_Applications/Relationship_to_HTML_FAQ#What_is_ARIA_and_how_does_it_allow_for_accessible_JavaScript_widgets.3F section What is ARIA and how does it allow for accessible JavaScript widgets? speaks of keyboard navigation. But this is different, evidently, than the extent Maciej envisions shortcuts to reach.

7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:49): f1259a9f9150e84e5c67c9e8f44cc1d2: if you want to know what aria is read http://developer.mozilla.org/en/docs/ARIA:_Accessible_Rich_Internet_Applications/Relationship_to_HTML_FAQ
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:49): I'm talking about special key combinations for specific commands
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:49): like when you hit Control-S in Microsoft Word on Windows and it saves the document
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:49): that's a keyboard shortcut
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:49): hitting tab to go to the next field is keyboard navigation
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:50): i saw the word keyboard
f1259a9f9150e84e5c67c9e8f44cc1d2 (03:50): I quoted from the FAQ.
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:50): 7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45: I'm not trying to pick on you, I just want to clarify for f1259a9f9150e84e5c67c9e8f44cc1d2
f1259a9f9150e84e5c67c9e8f44cc1d2 (03:51): Thanks for the clarification - I was tending toward that.
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:51): yes right now if you want keyboard shortcuts you have to hack it with an onkeydown listener on <body> or something
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:51): onkeypress doesn't work the same in IE as others, so onkeydown works better i've found
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:52): IE doesn't fire onkeypress for everything you'd think it should
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:52): key events are an area where interoperability is lacking
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:52): and sadly the relevant DOM specs do not cover them at all

139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:53): browsers also differ on whether you are allowed to see the key events for key combinations that are built-in browser shortcuts, and whether you can prevent the default action on them
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:54): i had to do a ton of work on all aspects of keyboard stuff in mozilla
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:54): i inherited a mess and tried to clean it up some, but it's still nasty
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:55): there are so many details to it
7e2617a66594d8932013a5022b280c45 (03:55): and no one ever wants to work on it
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:57): we have someone who likes fixing keyboard stuff
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (03:58): but the lack of consistency between browsers and lack of formal spec make it painful

f1259a9f9150e84e5c67c9e8f44cc1d2 (04:00): Observing the HTML5 communications at least showed me that my troubles in understanding some HTML4 weren't just me. And I appreciate more the UA developer's. And I also wonder how some of this 'basic' stuff was left alone in specifications? Oh, well, water over the ...
